data.price: By the dawn,
and the ten nights[1],
data.footnotes: [1] i.e., the first ten nights of the lunar month of Dhul-Hijjah.

data.price: and the even and the odd[2],
and by the night when it comes,
are these oaths not sufficient for those who have sense?
data.arabic: هَلۡ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٞ لِّذِي حِجۡرٍ

data.price: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ‘Ād
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

data.price: of Iram[3], who were people of great stature,
data.footnotes: [3] Iram: an ancient tribe; or a well-known tribe in Yemen; or the grandfather of the people of ‘Aad, etc. Prophet Hūd was sent to the people of ‘Aad.

data.price: the like of whom had never been created in the land;
data.arabic: ٱلَّتِي لَمۡ يُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ

data.price: and Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the Valley;
and the mighty and powerful[4] Pharaoh?
data.footnotes: [4] Or the owner of the stakes by which he used to torture people.

data.price: All of them transgressed in the land,
and spread therein much corruption,
so your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
Indeed, your Lord is ever vigilant.
As for man, when he is tested by his Lord by honoring him and bestowing blessings upon him, he says, “My Lord has [deservedly] honored me[5]!”
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَكۡرَمَنِ
data.footnotes: [5] Instead of being grateful, he is proud, attributing the favor to his own merit.

data.price: But when he is tested by restricting his provision, he says, “My Lord has [undeservedly] humiliated me!”
data.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَهَٰنَنِ

data.price: No indeed[6]! You are not kind to the orphan,
data.footnotes: [6] It is not as you think. Allah puts people to test through prosperity and hardship and rewards their gratitude and patience in the Hereafter.

data.price: nor do you urge one another to feed the needy,
and you greedily consume the entire inheritance[7],
and love wealth immensely.
No indeed! When the earth is crushed over and over,
data.arabic: كَلَّآۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكّٗا دَكّٗا

data.price: and your Lord comes[8] with the angels, rank after rank,
and Hell is brought near on that Day – this is when man will understand, but what is the use of that understanding?
data.arabic: وَجِاْيٓءَ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ

data.price: He will say, “Would that I had sent forth something for my [eternal] life!”
None can punish as He punishes on that Day,
and none can bind as He binds.
[It will be said to the believer,] “O the tranquil soul!
Return to your Lord, well pleased and pleasing [to Him].
Join My [righteous] slaves,
and enter My Paradise.”
